image.altText: A man recording on a go pro in windy wet weather.

props.synopsis: The downgraded Hurricane Milton is moving back out into the Atlantic Ocean, but the National Hurricane Centre is still reporting heavy rainfall and damaging winds in east-central Florida. Follow live.

title.children: Hurricane Milton moving off east coast but still producing hurricane-force winds over Florida

image.altText: A torn American flag weaves in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene and before the arrival of Hurricane Milton, St. Pete BeachFlorida

props.synopsis: Incredible pictures of the devastation of Hurricane Milton in the US are already being shared online. But amongst the real footage is a flood of fakes. Here's how to spot them.

title.children: Before you believe that hurricane video you just saw, ask yourself these four questions

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks downwards.

props.synopsis: A senior staffer to Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles has alleged she was forced out of her job after raising an internal bullying complaint.

title.children: Deputy PM's top staffer says she was forced out of her job after raising a bullying complaint

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing at dispatch box in Parliament.

props.synopsis: Under pressure and reverting to his worst instincts, Anthony Albanese used Tourette syndrome as an insult in parliament. You just had to look at two of his ministers' faces to see how far he'd fouled.

title.children: Eyes darting, mouths open: You just had to look at his ministers' faces to see how far Albanese had fouled

image.altText: Wenneng Xie celebrates

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are desperate for a new manager bounce as they take on China, with both teams desperate for a victory as the road to World Cup qualification continues at Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: China takes shock lead over Socceroos in crucial must-win World Cup qualifier

image.altText: Trump Harris composite

props.synopsis: Professor Allan Lichtman is the "Nostradamus" of US politics. His system has seen him predict the winner of elections consistently since the 1980s and he believes this one is already in the bag.

title.children: Harris or Trump? This political analyst says the race for the White House is already over

image.altText: A drone and machine parts scattered in a room.

props.synopsis: To fill an urgent labour shortage in wartime Russia, the Kremlin has been recruiting women aged 18-22 from places like Uganda, Rwanda, Kenya, South Sudan, Sierra Leone and Nigeria, as well as the South Asian country of Sri Lanka.

title.children: Africans recruited to work in Russia say they were duped into building drones for use in Ukraine

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman with a black blazer and glasses sitting in a courtyard

props.synopsis: The national children's commissioner and justice groups have warned against the Northern Territory government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility, saying it is "not based on evidence". It comes as the Australian Himan Rights Commission recommends a national approach to youth justice.

title.children: 'Australia is out of step': Calls for national approach to youth justice as NT prepares to lower age

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: British YouTube personality and rapper Yung Filly is granted bail by a Perth court after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in his hotel room following a show at a Perth nightclub.

title.children: British rapper Yung Filly bailed after being charged with sexually assaulting woman in Perth hotel room

image.altText: Police have arrested the husband of Frances Crawford over her alleged murder

props.synopsis: Police have charged the husband of Frances Crawford with murder.

title.children: Husband of Queensland psychologist who died in apparent ride-on lawnmower incident charged with murder

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and Joe Biden shake hands in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden and Benjamin Netanyahu have broken nearly two months of silence with a phone call at a tense time in the Middle East — and in their relationship.

title.children: After expletive-ridden extracts released, Biden and Netanyahu talk for the first time in months

image.altText: Albanese meets Li Qiang China

props.synopsis: The prime minister received an assurance from Chinese Premier Li Qiang at a meeting in Laos.

title.children: Chinese trade restrictions on Australian lobsters to be lifted before Chinese New Year

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe addresses the media wearing a suit and red glasses

props.synopsis: Andrew O'Keefe entered early guilty pleas to violating and AVO after he went to a Point Piper home in July.

title.children: Former TV host at his 'final crossroads' after sentencing for breaching AVO and meth possession

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and a bindi on her forehead smiles.

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens leader says they will not disendorse a candidate for Murrumbidgee, Harini Rangarajan, who made a blog post in 2023 comparing Osama bin Laden to Jesus Christ, in the upcoming territory election.

title.children: ACT Greens leader says candidate's blog post comparing Osama bin Laden to Jesus Christ is 'not a reflection of our party as a whole'

image.altText: A sign reads 'BEAUMARIS PRIMARY SCHOOL' behind gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A survivor of "shocking" sexual abuse at a Melbourne primary school has received what his lawyer has called "the biggest publicly-known payment to an abuse survivor in Australia" in an extraordinary $8 million settlement with the Victorian Education Department.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivor to receive $8 million in record-breaking settlement

image.altText: A boy stands in a doorway while a police car with flashing lights is parked outside.

props.synopsis: Claire thought that she'd escaped domestic violence after leaving her abusive partner, but she then struggled to find help with the violent meltdowns from her trauma-affected son.

title.children: Claire's son had violent meltdowns so bad she called the police. Here's what she wished she knew then

image.altText: He wears a cap and blue shirt and stands near a shipping container

props.synopsis: Veteran truck driver Kym Mozol's vehicle was bogged for almost a week in outback Western Australia. He is now in a "mad panic" as he races against the clock to get to his daughter's wedding in Adelaide.

title.children: Truck driver racing to daughter's wedding after week-long outback bogging ordeal

image.altText: The two whales are pictured from above in a very turquoise blue ocean

props.synopsis: The federal government is releasing a plan for the management of Australia's south-east marine parks, revealing intentions to expand the areas where new oil and gas projects and fishing are banned.

title.children: Government proposes new oil, gas, fishing bans for Australia's most treasured and 'exploited' oceans

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the club have refuted claims made by its Indigenous former players, calling the allegations "vague and embarrassing".

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club prepares to fight claims of 'racist culture' in Federal Court

image.altText: Bunnings store sign

props.synopsis: Bunnings is Australia's most trusted brand. But allegations the hardware chain has been abusing its market power have prompted a Senate inquiry that is set to scrutinise the market power of many large format retailers.

title.children: 'Too big, too powerful?' Main Bunnings competitor lashes out about the hardware chain's dominance

image.altText: Sam Konstas with his bat across his chest as he celebrates a Sheffield Shield century.

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas continues to flag his potential as a star of the future, writing his name alongside Ricky Ponting in the history books with another Sheffield Shield century.

title.children: NSW teenager Konstas shines with Ponting-like Sheffield Shield feat

image.altText: A rickshaw in Bangladesh is cycled through flood waters covering the frame with a passenger in tow.

props.synopsis: A study of scenarios where the world temporarily exceeds 1.5C of warming raises concerns for effects that may not be reversible for decades — or longer.

title.children: Temporarily overshooting 1.5C climate target more damaging than we thought: study

image.altText: A person in a helmet and police jumpsuit holds a brown kelpie with ropes attached.

props.synopsis: An adventurous dog who got into trouble off the rocks of a Sydney suburb has to be hoisted to safety in a dramatic rescue involving NSW Police Rescue and Bondi surf lifesavers.

title.children: Gus the kelpie escapes with 'emotional scars' after dramatic rescue off Clovelly cliffs

image.altText: A blue tent set up at the site of a police shooting with cars along the road.

props.synopsis: The fatal shooting of an Indigenous man at a property in Newcastle last year was "fast and totally unexpected," an inquest has heard. The Deputy State Coroner will deliver her findings at a later date.

title.children: Inquest into fatal police shooting told officer had 'no choice' but to fire his weapon

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark green hijab and blazer stands in a grass field, serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman's new political party may not be troubling Labor, but it still has plenty of other headaches to worry about.

title.children: Fatima Payman's big reveal of her new political party has done little to trouble Labor

image.altText: Aerial photos of new cars, mostly white, lined up a Fremantle Port after unloading in November 2023.

props.synopsis: An aerial photograph of new cars at Fremantle Port tells the story of modern car colours — a sea of white, dotted with some grey/silver and black, with only occasional splashes of red or blue.

title.children: Bright colours banished as white wins out in a monochrome new car market

image.altText: A dark-haired woman stands in a unit near a window that overlooks a road.

props.synopsis: A man broke into this woman's home and raped her after she returned from a jog. She's challenging courts and prisons to do justice differently in the hope of curbing re-offending and putting survivors at the centre of the story.

title.children: Woman raped by a stranger in her own home finds justice meeting attacker in prison

image.altText: Aran Sherani, wearing a grey tracksuit, arrives at the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A man found guilty of terrorism-related offences after he lit bushfires and pledged his allegiance to Islamic State will spend at least six years behind bars.

title.children: Man found guilty of terrorism-related offences sentenced to at least six years behind bars

image.altText: two lions

props.synopsis: The zoo says 19-year-old Mujambi was euthansed after suffering a medical episode, and the decision was made to also euthanse his  partner, 23-year-old Amani, for her own welfare.

title.children: Adelaide Zoo's only lions euthanased marking the 'end of an era'

image.altText: Three young women eating instant noodles with chopsticks.

props.synopsis: Munch on a packet of chips, slurp up a bowl of noodles or tuck into a salami sandwich, and there's a good chance you're also eating monosodium glutamate (MSG). So is it really as bad for us as we're led to believe?

title.children: MSG has been misunderstood for decades. Scientists are now correcting the record

image.altText: A man in a blue suit clenches his jaw as reporters hold microphones to his face. He's against a wood wall.

props.synopsis: The former US president attempted to stall The Apprentice's release ahead of the 2024 election, citing Hollywood interference. Does he have a point?

title.children: The Apprentice review: Donald Trump would hate this unofficial biopic — but not for the reasons you expect

image.altText: Kevin McCloud stands underneath the Sydney Harbour Bridge. His hands are in his pockets and a green kombi van is behind him

props.synopsis: The host of the popular UK lifestyle show says he's grateful for the people willing to let cameras behind the scenes — "sometimes mistakenly" — while they push the boundaries on what's possible in design.

title.children: Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud gets real on the show's 'great legacy' — its own drinking game
